p: Introductions: Effective antibiotic therapy, which can be defined as the timely administration of the antibiotic to which the causative microorganism is susceptible using the right dose, has been associated with improved outcomes in severe sepsis or septic shock. However, antibiotic dosing errors are not uncommon. This study evaluated the frequency and the risk factors of antibiotic dosing errors in patients with severe sepsis or septic shock.
